transportAdvice: Maui has a limited public bus system that connects major towns and some resort areas, but coverage is infrequent and not well-suited for spontaneous sightseeing. Renting a car is strongly recommended for most visitors, as walking between attractions is generally impractical given the island's spread-out layout; taxis and ride-hail options are available but limited outside of resort corridors.

weather.description: Mild and pleasant with occasional showers, especially on the windward side; one of the cooler months but still warm enough for beach activities.
Similar to January with comfortable temperatures and a chance of rain; peak season for whale watching in the channel waters.
Gradual warming begins with a mix of sun and showers; humpback whales are still commonly spotted through mid-month.
Rain becomes less frequent and sunshine increases, making this a very pleasant month for outdoor exploration and water sports.
Warm and mostly sunny with low rainfall; trade winds keep conditions comfortable and ideal for snorkeling and hiking.
Early summer brings reliably sunny skies and calm ocean conditions, popular for families and water activities.
Hot and sunny with strong trade winds that provide some relief; one of the busiest tourist months with excellent beach weather.
Peak summer heat with high humidity; ocean conditions are generally calm and visibility for snorkeling is excellent.
Still warm and mostly dry though humidity remains elevated; crowds begin to thin slightly after the summer peak.
Transition into the wetter season begins with occasional showers returning; temperatures remain warm and inviting.
Rainfall increases noticeably, particularly on the north and east shores; still plenty of sunshine on the leeward west side.
Cooler and wetter than summer months but still mild by most standards; holiday crowds arrive and early humpback whale sightings are possible.
